text: シンジ君に何も言う資格ない / もういい / その上こうやって / 都合のいい時だけ男にすがろうとする / ずるい女なのよ / あの時だってカジ君を利用してただけかもしれない / やんなるわ
translation: I have no right to say anything to Shinji. Enough already. On top of that, I try to cling to men only when it's convenient. I'm such a cunning woman. Back then, I might have just been using Kaji. I'm disgusted with myself.

vocabulary.meaning: to cling to, to depend on
to use, to make use of

grammar: すがろうとする uses volitional form + とする to express 'trying to do something'

text: もういいやめろ / 自分に絶望するわよ / ああああああ
translation: That's enough, stop it. I'll end up despairing of myself. Ahhhh.

vocabulary.meaning: stop it (imperative form of やめる)

grammar: 絶望する - the verb form of the noun 絶望, meaning 'to despair' or 'to lose hope'

text: ねえシンジー キスしようか / ん? 何? / キスよ、キス。したことないでしょ? / うん。 / じゃあ、しよう。 / どうして? / 退屈だからよ。
translation: Hey Shinji, shall we kiss? Hm? What? A kiss, a kiss. You've never done it, have you? Yeah. Then let's do it. Why? Because I'm bored.
grammar: しようか is volitional form + か, used to suggest or propose doing something together

text: 退屈だからって、そんな。 / お母さんの命日に女の子とキスするの嫌?
translation: Just because you're bored, that's... Do you hate kissing a girl on your mother's death anniversary?
grammar: だからって is a casual contraction of だからといって, meaning 'just because'

text: 天国から見てるかもしれないからって。 / 別に。 / それとも怖い? / 怖くないよ、キスくらい。 / はっ、磨いてるわよね。 / うん。 / じゃあ、行くわよ。
translation: Because she might be watching from heaven, you mean? Not really. Or are you scared? I'm not scared of something like a kiss. Ha, you do brush your teeth, right? Yeah. Okay, here I go.
grammar: くらい after a noun minimizes its importance - 'something as trivial as a kiss'

text: 鼻息がこそばゆいから息しないで
translation: Your breath through your nose is ticklish, so don't breathe.
grammar: しないで is the negative te-form, used here as a soft command meaning 'don't do'

text: あっ?
translation: Huh?
grammar: Simple interjection expressing surprise or realization

text: うえぇ、やっぱ暇つぶしにやるもんじゃないわ
translation: Ugh, kissing really isn't something you should do just to kill time.
grammar: もんじゃない is casual form of ものではない, expressing 'should not do' or 'not something one does'

text: ほら、着いたぞ、しっかりしろ
translation: Hey, we've arrived. Pull yourself together.

vocabulary.meaning: to pull oneself together, to be firm

grammar: しろ is the imperative form of する, giving a direct command

text: カジさん
translation: Kaji-san...
grammar: Simple address using the polite suffix さん

text: カジさん
translation: Kaji-san...
grammar: Repeated address showing emotional attachment or neediness

text: じゃあ、俺は帰るから / カジさんも泊まっていけば?
translation: Well, I'm heading home. / Why don't you stay over too, Kaji-san?
grammar: ていけば is te-form + いく in conditional form, suggesting 'why don't you (do and go/continue)'

text: この格好で出勤したら笑われちゃうよ / ええ?大丈夫よ。ねええ。カジさんてば。 / またな。
translation: If I went to work dressed like this, I'd be laughed at. / Huh? It's fine. Hey. Kaji-san, come on. / See you.
grammar: てば is a casual suffix used to get someone's attention or express mild frustration

text: ラベンダーの香りがする。 / すまないが、二人ともカツラギのこと頼んだぞ。 / はい。 / じゃあ、おやすみ。 / おやすみなさい。
translation: There's a lavender scent. / Sorry, but I'm counting on you two to take care of Katsuragi. / Yes. / Well, goodnight. / Goodnight.
grammar: 頼んだぞ uses past tense + ぞ for emphatic request - 'I'm counting on you'

text: どうしたの?元きないね。 / あんたなんかとキスしたからよ!
translation: What's wrong? You seem down. / It's because I kissed someone like you!
grammar: なんか after a person is dismissive/derogatory - 'someone like you' (in a negative way)

text: では続いて女子綾波
translation: Next, for the girls, Ayanami.
grammar: 続いて is the te-form of 続く used adverbially to mean 'following' or 'next'

text: 綾波は今日も休みか / Пс-с-с.
translation: Ayanami is absent again today, huh. / Psst.
grammar: か at the end of a statement indicates rhetorical confirmation or mild surprise

text: 2日酔いの調子はどうだ? / おかげでやっと冷めたわ / そりゃよかった / これがあなたの本当の仕事? / それともアルバイトかしら? / どっちかな?
translation: How's the hangover? / Thanks to that, I've finally sobered up. / That's good. / Is this your real job? Or is it a side job? / Which one, I wonder?

vocabulary.meaning: to cool down, to sober up

grammar: おかげで expresses 'thanks to' something, often used both sincerely and sarcastically

text: 特務機関NERV特殊監査部所属カジ領事 / 同時に日本政府内務省調査部所属カジ領事でもあるわけね / バレバレか? / ネルフは甘く見ないで
translation: Kaji Ryoji, belonging to NERV Special Agency's Special Inspection Division. At the same time, you're also Kaji Ryoji belonging to the Japanese Government's Ministry of Internal Affairs Investigation Division, right? / Was it that obvious? / Don't underestimate NERV.
grammar: わけね uses わけ (reason/explanation) + ね for confirmation - 'so that's how it is, right?'

text: イカリ司令の命令か? / 私の独断よ / これ以上バイトを続けると / 死ぬわ
translation: Is this Commander Ikari's order? / It's my own decision. / If you continue this side job any further, you'll die.
grammar: これ以上...と means 'if (you do) any more than this' - expressing a warning about consequences

text: イカリ司令は俺を利用してる / まだ行けるさ
translation: Commander Ikari is using me. / I can still keep going.

vocabulary.meaning: to use, to make use of

grammar: さ at the end adds casual assertion or reassurance to the statement

text: だけどカツラゲに隠し事をしてたのは謝るよ / 昨日のお礼にチャラにするわ / それはどう思う / ただ
translation: But I do apologize for keeping secrets from you, Katsuragi. / I'll call it even as thanks for last night. / What do you think about that? / However...
grammar: チャラにする means 'to call it even' or 'to cancel out' - colloquial expression

text: 司令やリッチャンも君に隠し事をしてる / それがこれさ
translation: The Commander and Ritsuko are also keeping secrets from you. / This is what it is.
grammar: や is used to list items non-exhaustively, implying there may be others

text: これは…
translation: This is...
grammar: Trailing off with は... indicates shock or inability to complete the thought

text: エヴァ… / いえ… / マサク… / そう…セカンドインパクトからそのすべての要であり / 始まりでもある
translation: Eva... / No... / Could it be... / Yes... The keystone of everything since Second Impact, and also the beginning.
grammar: であり...でもある uses formal copula forms to link two descriptions of the same thing

text: アダムだ / アダム…あの第一使徒がここに… / 確かに ネルフは私が考えているほど甘くないわね
translation: It's Adam. / Adam... The First Angel is here... / Indeed, NERV isn't as naive as I thought.
grammar: ほど甘くない - 'not as ~ as' structure using ほど for comparison

text: ご / 視聴ありがとうございました
translation: Thank you for watching.

vocabulary.word: ありがとうございました
vocabulary.reading: ありがとうございました

grammar: ございました is the polite past form, used in formal expressions of gratitude
